task.title: Add Certificate for Canadian Customer
task.shortdesc: This is a short description of Add Certificate for Canadian Customer

prereq.p: Add an exempt customer for which you want to add an exemption certificate.

context.p: If you need to exempt a Canadian customer from both federal GST and provincial tax, such as PST, QST, or HST, add a multijurisdictional exemption certificate for the customer. Create multijurisdictional certificates directly in the Avalara platform, and you can't import them on a spreadsheet..

step.cmd: From Avalara Home , go to Exemptions Customer Certificates .
Use the filters on the left to filter the Canada customer from the Region of customer address field, and then select Apply.
From Avalara Home , go to Exemptions Customer Certificates .

Select the region that you want from the Regions covered by this certificate list. Region details appear on selecting the regions covered by the certificate. If a reason for exemption isn’t available in a specific region, it won't appear on the list.

choices.choice: To exempt all tax:Select Canada (GST) and all provinces in which you do business.

substep.cmd: To exempt all tax:Select Canada (GST) and all provinces in which you do business.
To exempt only the federal Canada GST rate:Select Canada (GST).
To exempt GST and HST:Select Canada (GST) and any of the HST provinces in which you do business: New Brunswick, Newfoundland and Labrador, Nova Scotia, Ontario, and Prince Edward Island.
To exempt PST/QST but still charge GST:Select the provinces that you want to be exempt, but don’t select Canada (GST).

step.cmd: Select the reason that you want from the Reason for the exemption list.

substep.cmd: You can refer to the exempt reason matrix for a list of valid reasons by region.
If you need the customer from GST and all provincial taxes, select Tribal Government.

info.note: Tribal Government is the only entity use code that exempts Canada (GST) tax and all provincial taxes. You can select a different entity use code if your customer isn’t exempt from Canada (GST), or if they’re exempt from GST but taxable at the provincial level.
